com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.utility

Class NetCom2Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.utility.NetCom2Utils

  • @APILevel
public class NetCom2Utils
extends Object
    This Utility Class defines some methods, that are commonly used within NetCom2

    Since those checks are stateless, they are static. Thread-Safety should not be necessary, else whatever needs Thread-Safety does not belong here

    Since this class is used mainly internally, it should not be used outside of the internal project. If you want to use it anyways, use it with care! This class is highly likely to be subject of change!

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

      • assertNotNull

        @APILevel
public static void assertNotNull(Object o)
        This checks for null. If the provided Object o is found to be null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        o - the Object, that should be tested against null
        See Also:
        assertNotNull(Object...)

      • assertNotNull

        @APILevel
public static void assertNotNull(Object... objects)
        Like assertNotNull(Object), this method checks for null.

        The difference is, that you may add any Number of Objects to check here.

        Parameters:
        objects - an array of Objects, that should be checked against null
        See Also:
        assertNotNull(Object)

      • parameterNotNull

        @APILevel
public static void parameterNotNull(Object object)
        This Method checks, if the given Object is null.

        Other than assertNotNull(Object) and assertNotNull(Object...), this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        So basically this Method checks, for illegal arguments, which in fact are null.

        Parameters:
        object - the Object that should be checked against null
        See Also:
        parameterNotNull(Object...)

      • parameterNotNull

        So basically this Method checks, for illegal arguments, which in fact are null.

      • wrap

        @APILevel
public static <T> OnReceiveTriple<T> wrap(OnReceiveSingle<T> onReceiveSingle)
        This Method is a short form for Wrapper.wrap(OnReceiveSingle) and uses an static instance of Wrapper

        This means you do not need to create Wrapper instances, whenever an OnReceive should be wrapped

        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic Type of the OnReceiveSingle
        Parameters:
        onReceiveSingle - the OnReceiveSingle that should be wrapped
        Returns:
        a wrapped OnReceiveTriple, that is used internally of the ReceivePipeline
        See Also:
        ReceivePipeline, wrap(OnReceive)

      • wrap

        @APILevel
public static <T> OnReceiveTriple<T> wrap(OnReceive<T> onReceive)
        This Method is a short form for Wrapper.wrap(OnReceive) and uses an static instance of Wrapper

        This means you do not need to create Wrapper instances, whenever an OnReceive should be wrapped

        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic Type of the OnReceive
        Parameters:
        onReceive - the OnReceive that should be wrapped
        Returns:
        a wrapped OnReceiveTriple, that is used internally of the ReceivePipeline
        See Also:
        ReceivePipeline, wrap(OnReceiveSingle)

      • runSynchronized

        @APILevel
public static void runSynchronized(Runnable runnable)
        Executes an runnable, but synchronized synchronizes over an Semaphore.

        Stays on current Thread

        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable, that should be executed synchronized

      • createNewDaemonThreadFactory

        @APILevel
public static NetComThreadFactory createNewDaemonThreadFactory()
        Creates a new NetComThreadFactory, which is normally not instantiable.

        The NetComThreadFactory is used for ExecutorService, that should produce NetComThread.

        Returns:
        a new Instance of the NetComThreadFactory

      • getThreadFactory

        @APILevel
public static ThreadFactory getThreadFactory()
        Returns an instance of NetComThreadFactory, which is created statically

        The NetComThreadFactory is used for ExecutorService, that should produce NetComThread.

        This instance is created once and never updated nor deleted. This is used for saving resources.

        Returns:
        a new Instance of the NetComThreadFactory

      • createNewCachedExecutorService

        @APILevel
public static ExecutorService createNewCachedExecutorService()
        Creates a new cached ExecutorService, based on the NetComThreadFactory.
        Returns:
        a new Instance of the ExecutorService.

      • getNetComExecutorService

        @APILevel
public static ExecutorService getNetComExecutorService()
        Returns a unified instances of an CachedExecutorService, based on the NetComThreadFactory.

        This instance is created once and never updated nor deleted. This is used for saving resources.

        Returns:
        a new Instance of the ExecutorService.

      • onNetComThread

        @APILevel
public static boolean onNetComThread()
        Returns whether or not the CurrentThread is an NetComThread.

        Since there can be more than one NetComThread, this method does a class type check

        Returns:
        true, if the current Thread is a NetComThread.

      • runLaterSynchronized

        @Asynchronous
public static void runLaterSynchronized(Runnable runnable)
        Executes an runnable, but synchronized synchronizes over an Semaphore.

        Leaves the runnable to be executed by the NET_COM_THREAD once it is ready.

        The time this is finished cannot be determined. It depends on how full the runnable queue is and whether or not the NET_COM_THREAD is blocked or not.

        Does not wait until the current Thread finishes.

        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable, that should be executed synchronized

      • runLater

        @Asynchronous
public static void runLater(Runnable runnable)
        Executes an runnable, with an indefinite time until execution.

        Leaves the runnable to be executed by the NET_COM_THREAD once it is ready.

        The time this is finished cannot be determined. It depends on whether or not the NET_COM_THREAD is blocked or not.

        Does wait until the current Thread finishes. So if you depend on the finish of this Runnable, DO NOT USE THIS METHOD!

        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable, that should be executed synchronized

      • runOnNetComThread

        @Asynchronous
public static void runOnNetComThread(Runnable runnable)
        Executes an runnable, on the NetComThread.

        Leaves the runnable to be executed by the NET_COM_THREAD once it is ready.

        The time this is finished cannot be determined. It depends on whether or not the NET_COM_THREAD is blocked or not.

        If this Method is executed on the NetComThread, the runnable will be executed immediately.

        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable, that should be executed synchronized

      • createAsynchronousIterator

        public static <T> Iterator<T> createAsynchronousIterator(Collection<T> of)
        Creates an ThreadSafe Iterator over the provided Collection
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the Collection
        Parameters:
        of - the Collection, that the Iterator should be iterated over
        Returns:
        an ThreadSafe iterator

      • createAsynchronousIterator

        public static <T> Iterator<T> createAsynchronousIterator(Collection<T> of,
                                                         boolean removeAllowed)
        Creates an ThreadSafe Iterator over the provided Collection

        If true is passed in as the removeAllowed the Iterator will use its Iterator.remove() on the provided Collection.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the Collection
        Parameters:
        of - the Collection, that the Iterator should be iterated over
        removeAllowed - whether or not the iterator should be allowed to remove elements from the provided Collection
        Returns:
        an ThreadSafe iterator

      • createNewNonDaemonThreadFactory

        public static ThreadFactory createNewNonDaemonThreadFactory()
        Creates a ThreadFactory that of which all Threads are nonDaemon.

        By Default, all NetComThreads are daemon.

        Returns:
        a new ThreadFactory

      • createNewNonDaemonExecutorService

        public static ExecutorService createNewNonDaemonExecutorService()
        Creates a ThreadFactory that of which all Threads are nonDaemon.

        By Default, all NetComThreads are daemon.

        Returns:
        a new ThreadFactory
